intro: Lockhartia acuta, commonly known as the acute lockhartia, is a species of orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and linear, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale yellow, typically blooming during the summer months. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts.
